page.title: 14The Landmark Trust.
page.content: The Landmark Trust,the organisation which has been granted the responsibility of running Lundy by the National Trust,is a charity which saves buildings of architectural and historic interest-making them avaliable for holiday lettings. It has properties all over Britain. Included in its list are follies, castles,gatehouses,ancient farmhouses, a cotton mill, a Martello tower,a water tower and an arsenic mine's engine house. The properties are available for holidays all the year round and all have some form of heating. Except for the hotel on Lundy (Millcombe) all are self-catering. {For further details contact The {Landmark Trust.The address and phone {number are on page 13. }
